intro: Calycera herbacea var. herbacea, commonly known as the slender calycera, is a herbaceous plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant features slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbel-like clusters. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a mild, slightly spicy scent. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks.
